// This header contains the peripheral pinout definitions for the
// Avnet MT3620 Starter Kit (SK) Rev2.  Note that the Rev2 Starter
// Kit has 3 optional configurations that are selectable by relocating
// zero ohm resistors.  See the on-line user guide for more details
// <insert URL here>
// Click socket #2 can be configured for either a 4-wire UART (ISU1)
// which is the default, or an SPI (ISU1) interface.
// The default UART configuration has R59 and R60 populated with
// zero ohm resistors, and R61 and R62 unpopulated.
// Conversely the SPI configuration is selected by un-populating R59
// and R60, and fitting zero ohm resistors on locations R61 and R62.
// The un-populated UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) interface can be configured for either
// a type 4A UART (ISU1) which is the default, or a type 2A SPI (ISU1)
// interface.
// The default UART configuration has R39 and R50 populated with
// zero ohm resistors, and locations R41 and R52 unpopulated.
// Conversely the SPI configuration is selected by un-populating R39
// and R50, and fitting zero ohm resistors on locations R41 and R52.
// The Grove connector can be configured for either I2C (ISU2) which
// is the default, or a type 2A UART (ISU2) TX and RX only
// The default I2C configuration has R57, R53 and R55 populated with
// zero ohm resistors, and R54 and R56 unpopulated.
// Conversely the UART configuration is selected by un-populating R57, R53,
// and R55, and fitting zero ohm resistors on locations R54 and R56

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_APP_STATUS_LED_YELLOW
Peripherals.Comment: Application status LED uses GPIO4.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_WLAN_STATUS_LED_YELLOW
Peripherals.Comment: WLAN status LED uses GPIO0.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_RED
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Red channel uses GPIO8.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_GREEN
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Green channel uses GPIO9.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_BLUE
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Blue channel uses GPIO10.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_BUTTON_A
Peripherals.Comment: User BUTTON A uses GPIO12.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_BUTTON_B
Peripherals.Comment: User BUTTON B uses GPIO13.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO42
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO42 is exposed on SOCKET1 (AN).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO43
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO43 is exposed on SOCKET2 (AN).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO34
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO34 is exposed on SOCKET2 (INT) and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 1, CTS).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO35
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO35 is exposed on SOCKET2 (RST) and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 3, BLE Reset).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO31
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO31 is exposed twice on SOCKET2 (SCK) and (TX) and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 2, TX).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO33
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO33 is exposed twice on SOCKET2  (SDI) and (RX) and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 3, RX).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO32
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO32 is exposed on SOCKET2 (SDO) and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 4 RTS).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO0
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO0 is exposed on SOCKET1 (PWM).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO1
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO1 is exposed on SOCKET2 and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 9 BLE DFU).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO2
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO2 is exposed on SOCKET1 (RST).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO5
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO5 is exposed on SOCKET1 (INT).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO28
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO28 is exposed twice on SOCKET1 (SDI) and (RX).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO26
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO26 is exposed twice on SOCKET1. (SCK) and (TX)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO37
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO37 is exposed on SOCKET1 (SCL), SOCKET2 (SCL), GROVE Connector (Pin 1, SCL), and OLED Display Connector (Pin 3, SCL).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO38
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO38 is exposed on SOCKET1 (SDA), SOCKET2 (SDA), GROVE Connector (Pin 2, SDA),and OLED Display Connector (Pin 4, SDA).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO39
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO39 is exposed on UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) (Pin 7, BLE Status/Int).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO29
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO29 is exposed on SOCKET1. (CS)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO27
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO27 is exposed on SOCKET1. (SDO)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER0
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 0: channel 0 is exposed on SOCKET1 (PWM), channel 1 is exposed on: SOCKET2 (PWM) and UART/BLE (PMOD) Connector (Pin 9 BLE DFU), channel 2 is exposed on: SOCKET1 (INT), SOCKET2 (INT) and UART/BLE (PMOD) Connector (Pin 7, BLE Status/Int) . Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO0, AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO1 and AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO2. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER1
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 1: channel 0 is used by Application Status LED, and channel 1 is used by WLAN status LED. Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_APP_STATUS_LED_YELLOW and AVNET_MT3620_SK_WLAN_STATUS_LED_YELLOW. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER2
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 2: channel 0 is used by User LED Red, channel 1 is used by User LED Green, channel 2 is used by User LED Blue. Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_RED, AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_GREEN, and AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_BLUE. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ADC_CONTROLLER0
Peripherals.Comment: ADC CONTROLLER 0: channel 0 is used by Ambient Light Sensor, channel 1 is exposed on SOCKET1 (AN), channel 2 is exposed on SOCKET2 (AN). Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO42 and AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO43. If this ADC controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU0_UART
Peripherals.Comment: ISU0 UART is exposed on SOCKET1.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU0_SPI
Peripherals.Comment: ISU0 SPI is exposed on SOCKET1).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_UART
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 UART is exposed on SOCKET2 and UART/BLE Connector (PMOD).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_SPI_CONFIGURABLE_SOCKET2
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 SPI is exposed on SOCKET2 when R59, R60, R61 and R62 are modified.  See Users Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_SPI_CONFIGURABLE_UART_BLE
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 SPI is exposed on UART/BLE Connector (PMOD) when R39, R50, R41 and R52 are modified.  See Users Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU2_UART_CONFIGURABLE_GROVE
Peripherals.Comment: ISU2 UART is also exposed on the Grove connector when Resistor locations R53, R54, R55, R56 and R57 are modified.  TX (Pin 2) RX (Pin 1)  See Users Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU2_I2C
Peripherals.Comment: ISU2 I2C is shared between on-device sensors, GROVE Connector, OLED DISPLAY Connector, SOCKET1, and SOCKET2.
